content.raw: actually there should be differences, try [this log file](https://www.dropbox.com/s/9f3y1fuagpgmn2a/nested_state.log?dl=0). Playing the log file with this branch produces correct results where nested models pose are updated over time. With the gazebo default branch, the nested models don't move with respect to the parent.
content.html: actually there should be differences, try this log file. Playing the log file with this branch produces correct results where nested models pose are updated over time. With the gazebo default branch, the nested models don't move with respect to the parent.

content.raw: I'm curious about one thing, logging seems to be working without this fix, and I feel that it shouldn't. Not sure what this means, but maybe somewhere we're doing the same thing twice, that is, setting the state for nested models somewhere besides ModelState?
content.html: I'm curious about one thing, logging seems to be working without this fix, and I feel that it shouldn't. Not sure what this means, but maybe somewhere we're doing the same thing twice, that is, setting the state for nested models somewhere besides ModelState?

content.raw: Sorry, I had approved but now I realized you probably forgot to set iterations?
content.html: Sorry, I had approved but now I realized you probably forgot to set iterations?

content.raw:
I think you can collapse this function to be:

`return this->modelStates.find(_modelName) != this->modelStates.end();`
content.html:
I think you can collapse this function to be:

return this->modelStates.find(_modelName) != this->modelStates.end();

content.raw: A throw seems unnecessary here. In general we should only use a throw if we have reached an unrecoverable error. Otherwise, use an error message with an appropriate return.
content.html: A throw seems unnecessary here. In general we should only use a throw if we have reached an unrecoverable error. Otherwise, use an error message with an appropriate return.

content.raw: Does this need to be on a separate line, or can you do `for (const auto &m : _model->NestedModels())`? Same question for line 49 above, and line 142 below.
content.html: Does this need to be on a separate line, or can you do for (const auto &m : _model->NestedModels())? Same question for line 49 above, and line 142 below.
